intro: Mirabilis alipes, commonly known as the red-flowered spider plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Nyctaginaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces small, green, egg-shaped fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Mirabilis alipes is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
